website_summaries.verdict: Streamline your fitness setup with a quality tool that facilitates dozens of core exercises.
pros: This hyperextension bench consists of a heavy-gauge 2 x 2 steel tube frame that’s powder-coated for maintenance-free operation and style
It allows you to target muscles in your lower back, core, glutes, and abdominals
The ankle pads are adjustable, but the unit as a whole is very simple to put together
cons: Some users have commented that the handlebars are not symmetrical

website_summaries.verdict: Good machine for back extensions but not the most comfortable for guys.
pros: Solid design with durable, well-made pieces that are simple to put together
The adjustable body fits short and tall frames, and it's sturdy enough to support weights
cons: Thin cushions and no gap in the seated area can make this an uncomfortable machine for some to use, particularly men

website_summaries.verdict: Isolate glutes and hamstrings with a tried and true classic.
pros: An at-home workout machine that targets backside muscles
Features adjustable ankle pads and assist handles
High remarks for lasting several years
cons: Given its industrial design, this product may not be comfortable for all body types

website_summaries.verdict: Versatile exercise equipment that can be used for different abdominal exercises and more. Hyperextension station helps prevents lower back injuries.
pros: Solid construction and heavy-duty padding provide comfort while minimizing injury
cons: Misaligned and off-center parts make using this difficult out of the box
People taller than 6' may have trouble using the machine

customer_reviews.title: IMMEDIATELY BROKE IN HALF
customer_reviews.text: My husband just put this entire machine together and as gripped the handles so he could get his hips on the pad and do his FIRST repetition the right handle broke completely off Metal and all! His is 6ft and 190 lbs. he probably applied 20 lbs of his weight to it when it just snapped off. Not able to put back on bc it was the actual metal bar that snapped in half! He never even got to use it once! So disappointed this was my birthday gift for him .
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Lewers

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased and received his hyperextension bench. Once assembled, I started to use it. After the first rep, the right handle that is used to assist in exiting the bench broke off at the joint where it is welded to the part that is screwed to the frame. After nearly landing on my head, I took a photo of the broken part. If I wasn't careful, I would have most likely fallen off the bench. I plan to call on Monday to ask for a refund and let the company know that this is one of the lowest quality pieces of exercise equipment I have ever purchased for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: For the price it can’t be beat!
customer_reviews.text: I own a CrossFit gym and paid almost $600 each for our Rogue GHD machines. I didn’t want to spend that kind of money for an emergency one at my house, so I bought this Marcy one. Now I’m not saying this quality compares to Rogue’s $600 version-it’s apples and oranges-but the insane difference in cost evens it out! For home use I think this is one heck of a good quality piece of equipment, and the price is just insanely affordable! I’d buy it again and I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Straight UP Straitz

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: I have used this one time (3 sets of 5 reps) and it is extremely uncomfortable to use. Upon looking at other similar pieces of equipment I have noticed that they have a cut out down the middle of the pad. This machine really pushes on my pelvic bone and creates quite a bit of pressure on my testicles. I assume that is what the cut out in the other ones is for, to relieve pressure on those two areas. I would like to return this piece of equipment, but I'm not sure that I can fit it back in the box. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for anyone over 5'2.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this for home use, I even bought a few kettle bells to various exercise with this bench. I'm only 6'1 and this is not compatible with anyone over 5'2. When I lay down my thighs are very uncomfortable, I thought maybe my body would acclimate to this but nope. And now it's to late to return it, so I'm stuck with a bench I can't use. In hindsight I wish I would've read the reviews. The concept is great, I wish I could extend seat or something.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Christmas, been wanting one for a while. finally got it put together and the same thing happened to me as another buyer had mentioned, the right handle snapped clean off at the weld and I went flying forward. I'm 6' 1" 205lbs and it snapped right off first shot. I wont be buying anything from this company ever again. garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Chills

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Use at your own risk. The welds that hold the arm handles are extremely poor. On first use, the arm started to bend down. The person using this device can easily lose balance because of this and fall while their legs are still around the back. The results could be a broken ankle or leg since you would end up falling sideways. Would never buy any products from this company. I paid for STANDARD SHIPPING. Used for less than 30 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered this to add to the gym and was a bit skeptical because of the price that it might be cheaply made but boy was I wrong. I have a socket set and had it put together within 15 minutes. Super easy build and very simple instructions. Within minutes I was competing with my kids to see who was going to work out on it first. I am a 5'5 woman and my ankles reach the grips just fine in distance. I am also 170 lbs and use a 40 lb weight to lift when I do my sit ups and it didn't feel like it was ever going to topple over. I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Happy in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Good Stand, HARD pad, No tools included.
customer_reviews.text: First, this got delivered within two days of the order. OUTSTANDING! Not hard to assemble; you will need wrenches to get this tightened done well. A small Allen Head wrench is provided, but is only for the seat. I used my own Allen head which allowed better grip. The pad is HARD. I am over 60and 5'9" and have been on Roman Chairs over the past 40 years, so I expect a level of initial discomfort. I simply added a towel on top of the pad, et viola!! Stable stand even with 60-70 pounds of dumbbells in my hands. All in all, a good buy. HINT: TIGHTEN EVERYTHING DOWN WELL!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Beckman

customer_reviews.title: Bolts are very oily/greasy - watch out!
customer_reviews.text: Overall - you cannot do situps on here and the fixed position makes it feel a little uncomfortable for hyperextensions. I returned my product. I suggest you get another product in which you can do situps and hyperextensions while having more adjustability. I will give it a 3 for this. Now the bolts are filled with grease or oil. It stains and drips very easily. Makes it a nightmare to use initially and setup (especially if it gets on carpet or on your clothes). I did not expect this aspect. If the position and doing only hyperextensions works fine for your body type, its a good buy for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how to rate this item
customer_reviews.text: The machine itself is great and does the job necessary but the arm broke off on its own. It was fairly weak when I got it but awkward when a 2 year old walks into your home office handing you this piece of a machine that he has definitely shouldn't have been able to remove by himself. I want to return it, however it does the job which I purchased it for so in a debate on what to do next. Really good machine, just cheaply made
customer_reviews.author: Veryeducated

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price and quality
customer_reviews.text: I am 5ft 2in 120 lb. Female....The handles are further back than at 24 Hour Fitness but I'm still able to get on with a step stool easily. I use the Big Agnes air core pillow it is rectangular and flat sold on Amazon. Much more comfortable with the air pillow. Very stable well made. I washed it so it didn't smell so much because before I washed it very pungent synthetic odor.....Very pleased with this product easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: juli

customer_reviews.title: Great chair had to make it mobile
customer_reviews.text: Very good chair, used it mainly for abs versus back/glutes. I recently moved and needed a smaller version so I looked online and nothing was found so I cut this one down and now it can be stored easily. I also made the bolts come out easly if Im running short on space. Great for me because I only do abs and need it mobile.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Vert sturdy, well made and adjust easily.
customer_reviews.text: Marcy makes good products. This is a solid piece of equipment. My husband is 6’1 and 240 lbs and it doesn’t budge when he is using it. I am a small female but it adjust easily to accommodate both of us.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy4Russ

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this, and I did at first......
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this, and I did at first. However, now that I've had it for a year, the screws that hold it together keep falling out. No matter how tightly I screw them back in, I keep finding them on the floor. Not having the screws makes the entire pad wobble dangerously. Also, I'm 5'5" and this unit worked for me, but we couldn't get it to adjust to be long enough for my 5'10" boyfriend to use. Definitely made for short people
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver!! Truly 👍
customer_reviews.text: I used it religiously for a month, in a pause now and will start it again. I love it and totally trust it. I began using it when my back was refusing to function and within 2 weeks it got back to where I forgot all about any back issue and it's been 2 months I have stopped for various reasons and my back is still going strong. Life Saver!! Truly :-)
customer_reviews.author: Sudipta Saha

customer_reviews.title: Great deal.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy , easy to put together. I got this so i can stretch and work on my lower back. Works just like the one i use at the gym. This was cheaper than used ones on Craigslist. Im 5'7" and 150 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: Always had back pain due to a old back injuries. Now I use this for 3 month about 4-5 days a week of 25 reps x 4 sets and I can lift heavier boxes, and even jump higher I think. Stomach area got thinner from mens size 42 to 38. Just make sure the ankle support is in the right height for you so you do not force your body into a position where oxygen is hard to reach the brain. Others say the handles are too short, but I've had no problem getting on and off.
customer_reviews.author: 88BB

customer_reviews.title: It’s alright but I’ve got better elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty well built, takes a while to assemble, not for larger guys though. It wobbles a bit on a solid wood floor and the bench you rest your body on feels like it’s going to break when I use it. I purchased another device which was better but this isn’t horrible. I’m 6’ 0” at 255 pounds. Not sure I’ll use it again, but I would give it to someone who suffered from a tight lower back.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: terrible for short legs.
customer_reviews.text: It’s fine if your legs are long enough. I’m 5’4” and I can just barely hook my heels under the rollers even though I’m not all the way forward. The platform is just too wide. The limited way I can use it forces my knees backwards as I go forward. It means I get half the workout with 10x the risk of falling or hurting myself. Other an exercises that would involve any other roller position are not optional. I regret buying this and wish I had purchased a better designed piece of equipment. Seems reasonably sturdy though, contrary to some other reviews. Mine has had no issues with quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lora Popolizio

customer_reviews.title: Far too unstable and getting into it have to place ...
customer_reviews.text: Far too unstable and getting into it have to place faith in construction---which did not help the use. I donated it off to a fitness charity and went with the much more stable Titan model\
customer_reviews.author: Troy Haliwell

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to home gym
customer_reviews.text: Great deal for the money. I find it solid and sturdy. Sits flat on a mat, not bolted to floor. Feels secure and steady when doing back hyperextensions with hands behind head, and situps with ankles locked to legpads. Base beneath hippad extends far enough out to provide full support against tipping, but just in case I strapped a 25 pound weight to the legpad pedestal, as a counterbalance. Not necessary, but why take a chance. Works great for me, 5/11" 160#.
customer_reviews.author: tom b

customer_reviews.title: I got a hernia yay
customer_reviews.text: 1- easy assembly but kind of wobbly 2- wasn't really what I wanted. I wanted more of a 45 degree hyperextension bench. But I only looked up Roman chairs because I didn't know the other name for them 3- I'm physically fit and healthy af and a 29 year old lady/girl/woman, but within 3 weeks of getting this and using it everyday I got a pouch of Douglas hernia. Using this was the only form of exercise I was doing for those 3 weeks so yeah that can happen. I hope my bowels don't become strangulated and I don't need surgery
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to do upside down situps. It works GREAT!!! I read a review or two that said the handles broke. I can't believe that. They are VERY sturdy. You would have had to use a hacksaw. This little device is sturdy enough for me to hang upside down on and do my situps with no problem. Its made VERY well. I disagree with the other reviews completely.
customer_reviews.author: Glenna

customer_reviews.title: very good, installed in about 30 minutes, very decent equipment.
customer_reviews.text: installed in about 30 minutes, seems to be very solid, after install, did two sets, 10 reps each, and I feel my lower back is more flexible/comfortable right away. pretty amazing.
customer_reviews.author: MKMR

customer_reviews.title: Great workout for your mid-section and upper legs!
customer_reviews.text: I've not used one of these since I was in college and this is just what I needed to fully work my mid-section, back, glutes, and legs! It is a bit awkward the first time you use it, but once you get the leg height adjusted properly, it really makes a great workout. Assembly took 20-25 minutes, and the materials and craftsmanship seem to be very good for home-equipment. I only wish the rear legs were a bit longer and as wide as the front, which would aid in balance for those of us who are taller, but it does exactly as it should!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Unit was fairly easy to put together, until I got to the damaged leg support. The bent portion made it difficult to get it on and difficult to slide it into different positions. As you can see both parts are showing signs of damage and abuse. Box did not indicate any problems when delivered. Make me wait 42 days AND send a damaged unit, nice job. I can only thank you, the anger and frustration got a few more sit-ups out of me.
customer_reviews.author: Peter B.

customer_reviews.title: Thin padding, otherwise good bench.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. This really helped with lower back pain. I use this bench everyday before lifting. I do hyper extensions as a warm up, it is stable and supports my weight. My only complaint is I wish there was more padding on the bench. Other than that it is a good bench and has helped with my lower back pain.
customer_reviews.author: kenpo saber

customer_reviews.title: Never dissapointed with Marcy products!
customer_reviews.text: I've been working on my home gym for a while and Marcy products have never disappointed me. This product is affordable, shipped fast and was super easy to put together (hubbs had it done in minutes,really). The leg pads are adjustable to work with your height/angle. Im 5'9" and 130 lbs and it works just fine for lower back work. I will have to do a little more adjusting for ab work but itll happen. Cant go wrong with this bench, its perfect for a home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Decompression works, Inversion tables dont work.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Solid construction. Amazing price. According to my doctor this table will dramatically help fix my L5S1 herniated disc. It will also help prevent future herniations. I have had friends use it. Thwy also have back injuries. They also love how it works. Do not use inversion tables. They don't work. Use this decompression table.
customer_reviews.author: mark m.

customer_reviews.title: Husband is Happy
customer_reviews.text: Shhh...don’t tell anyone, I tried it today. Bought it for my husband who LOVES it. He’s a desk jockey and comes home and get on this thing right away. I’m allergic to working out, but got on it today to see why he was devoted. Really stretched my back out. Wow! And I’m a bored house wife right (?) but found it kind of fun. Oh no! I may be addicted too!
customer_reviews.author: BunnieHill

customer_reviews.title: This Roman Chair is absolutely the best GYM QUALITY piece of equipment I could have ever hoped for!
customer_reviews.text: I've always worked out and had the strongest lower back any trainer ever saw. I weigh 135 lbs and am 5'3' tall, putting in my first home gym at age 64. I assembled the chair in less than one hour from opening box to tightening the bolts. Stable as can be and STURDY as a tank. My 230 lb very tall husband is a surfer not a gym rat but it fits him and now he's hooked. Awesome equipment though it needs to be used carefully and a trainer should show you if you've not used one in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Ingram MD

customer_reviews.title: 60/40. Works well enough.
customer_reviews.text: A cheap weld allowed one of the arms to break. Luckily it happened slowly and I was able to get off safely. The bench remains 100% functional without the arms but it is a little more difficult to get off. Especially after a taxing set. Also, I weigh 185lbs and have to anchor the rear "legs" so the bench doesn't tilt forward whilst working out without weights. Do not use without anchors if you are going to use weights. You might faceplant. Otherwise, does it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Strong well built product, but not very "short" friendly...
customer_reviews.text: I gave only four stars as the chair is a tank as far as being well built. Very nice in that regard, Without an ability to adjust though, my short fiance has a tough time exercising on it. Being taller - 6' - I'm fine, but if you're shorter you may want to spend a few more bucks on an adjustable model.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Jeffrey S Forrester

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap! I got it when it was $45 normally I see it around 60! Anyways, it came fast and in tact the box wasn't ruined in anyway. It was so simple and easy to put together around 10 minutes tops. It does just what it says and works perfect for me as well I'm a pretty short guy and was wondering if it'd work for me but it did. Bottom line great product for working out.
customer_reviews.author: Jasper Oaks

customer_reviews.title: Great device, but not built for people under 6ft
customer_reviews.text: Great for hamstring and lower back exercise. Be forewarned, if you’re weak you’re not going to lift your body that much. I’m 6’1 and it for me perfect. No idea how a shorter person could use this properly as you’re suppose to swing from the hips, not having your back bent at all.
customer_reviews.author: A. Customer

customer_reviews.title: the only issue I have is that the flat nature of the pad isn’t really comfortable for a guy
customer_reviews.text: It’s a solid piece of equipment, the only issue I have is that the flat nature of the pad isn’t really comfortable for a guy. The old one I had had two pads that you would rest your thighs on leaving the middle free from being squished. I’m hoping to find a replacement cushion for this one that is similar to my last one. Otherwise I’ll need to get a different model that’s designed for a man to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Bates

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a home workout!
customer_reviews.text: This Roman Chair is perfect for back and abdominal exercises. It is sturdy and well-make. I appreciate the quick delivery and the fact that the price remained reasonable, which has not been the case for most exercise equipment being sold through Amazon during the quarantine. The price gouging is unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberli Lengning

customer_reviews.title: First class company, first rate equipment.
customer_reviews.text: First class company, first rate equipment. I wrote quite a lengthy review about my personal experience with this company when I reviewed the Marcy Adjustable Utility Bench - SB510 (model number). In it I speak specifically about this companies virtues and ethics which are manifold. If you search the item I just named then you will be able to read the review I gave this company. Just one more completely unsolicited comment; if you buy from this company you will not be sorry you did.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend the regular roman chair, not this one
customer_reviews.text: I almost broke my spine. I guess this is bad for ligaments. This is different from other Roman chair. If you are consider this one, I would recommend the regular one. I couldn't exersize for a week after using this and this even hard to get refund. It is too big and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great for value, great build
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why some users are so picky about this type of equipment. This thing works great and is made very, especially for the money. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the spring loaded knob for quick height adjustment. I'm 5'11'' 170lbs and this thing doesn't come close to moving when I use it. I also use for crunches.
customer_reviews.author: gman

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and Safety Concern
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Marcy Adjustable Hyperextension Roman Chair for my Wife's personal training studio. After installation my wife was exited to try out the equipment. During the First Use of the bench, the welded arm piece came off. Poor quality product and safety concern.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roman chair
customer_reviews.text: Yes...it is not a commercial Roman chair but the quality is extremely decent. My son and I use it, keeping the same settings. I’m 5.8 for 158lb and my teen is 5.6 for 190lb and both find it comfortable and very effective. We like the Marcy brand, we recently bought a gym station from them. Excellent quality/price item.
customer_reviews.author: Daud Sharif

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing and inexpensive piece of equipment! However when I put it together something is a little off, it wobbles...my husband took it apart did it himself he said the same thing there's something a bit off but only about a quarter of an inch...still does the job...
customer_reviews.author: FINALLY FEE

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, sturdy once tightened.
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old read and understood the instructions. She helped put it together. Even the nuts and bolts are labeled with numbers that correspond to pictures. Oh yeah and we were both exercising on it the same day. Sturdy piece.
customer_reviews.author: Kitten

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price. The item however (like most things) are not ment for taller people. I am 5'10" and this item can not be adjusted forward and backward. I use this for sit ups and it requires weights. Otherwise it tends to move around on you. Bars are stable and can purchase brackets to bolt to the floor of that is preferred. Overall well built.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Good unit for back extension
customer_reviews.text: This unit does the job. The quality is sturdy and it's easy to assembly. Saw a number of reviews where people complained about the directs but I didn't find them really bad. The directions could be better but not difficult. My complaint is more about the design, I found it a bit short, even though 6 foot reviewers stated the length fit them. I'm only 5'5" and the rollers hit me too far up on my calf, causing cramping. The ones at the gym are slightly longer with the rollers hitting at my ankles. The price can't be beat
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good and serves it's purpose
customer_reviews.text: I'm bigger guy, would have liked to see more padding but doesn't tip, not defective, does what it's supposed to. I will note that heavier men (persons) should not concern over tipping which is common for some brands. The reason for four stars as I would like to see more padding. My wife is not as durable as I and she mentioned discomfort after final sets...so for women or men with sensitive skin , use a towel as extra padding or spend more money for thicker padding. I'm happy
customer_reviews.author: Noah Yates

customer_reviews.title: For the price this works great. I'm 6'0 and 240lbs and it supports me ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price this works great. I'm 6'0 and 240lbs and it supports me fine in both hyperextentions and sit-ups. Doesn't rock or tip on me at all even with my weight. Not nearly as good as gym quality but for the price what do you expect.
customer_reviews.author: BrianL

customer_reviews.title: Stable piece of equipment at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: I received this item today and was pleasantly surprised with the quality and ease of assembly. I work with tools daily in my business and consider myself very mechanically inclined but I can say that assembly is easy. Parts are labeled and organized very well. The quality exceeds my expectations given the price. I am 6’ tall / 205 lbs and find this to be comfortable and sturdy to use. It is not as stable as a commercial piece of course... but it does the job at a low price point. Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend. Easy to assemble and provides a great workout
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to assemble and I fit on it perfectly. I am 5'7" tall. It is sturdy and well made. I looked at so many different brands and I am so happy that I chose this one. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Cameron

customer_reviews.title: I've got your back!
customer_reviews.text: for being inexpensive it does the job. Maybe a little rattle, but really causes no troubles with operations. Note if you're extremely tall it might not work the best for you with where your ankles go. I'm 5'10" have it set to the top for the feet. Remember when you do this that you should have your knees bent a little bit and flex those glutes!
customer_reviews.author: Wild Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: A great quality product for a great price! This gives me great opportunities to strengthen my core on all sides (front, sides, and back). Relatively easy to put together. I struggled a bit with the diagram and the instructions. All of the pieces and tools came packaged together, which made it easier. A very sturdy product - there is no wobbling when I use this (I'm 220 lbs). I'm very confident in its ability to support me. The only downside I noticed was that the foam rollers that support your calves/ankles had a very strong smell coming out of the box. Makes me wonder what chemicals are rubbing off. I would definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Exercise helps alleviate back pain and strengthen my core. This is the same piece of equipment that my employer has in the office gum. Decided to purchase one for my use while at home.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied Prime User 😉

customer_reviews.title: This is a great piece to add to your home gym
customer_reviews.text: This is a great piece to add to your home gym! The build quality is excellent and very sturdy. Assembly took me less than 20 minuets and was very easy. The price was what really attracted me to this particular bench. For $70 I wonder how they are making any money on it. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is it would be very helpful to be able to adjust the distance from the leg rest to the bench. It would be super easy to drill new holes to move the bench a little more forward though.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: The Best Machine Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have been having issues with my right hip for years and tight lower back. This arrived last week to my place in NJ and omg it's the best thing ever. I feel like a new person and I use it 5 times a day. I stand straighter and NO pain in my hip!! Thanks so much Stephanie Hunter
customer_reviews.author: Fun House TV

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: Really like this Roman chair. I have serious back issues and it helps. Was recommended to me by my doctor. Kind of hurts your hipbones but I use a pillow so ok. Excellent product for reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Ann T

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Gret piece of equipment for the price. I paid around $65 on Amazon. It went together pretty quickly, about 20 minutes. The only tool you'll need is an adjustable wrench, it comes with the allen wrench needed. It all seemed pretty good quality, especially for a Made in China product. I think it will last for years. One of the bars that holds the foam leg rollers was welded together slightly off, but I don't think it effects the function of it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Great piece for the price. Package arrived intact and all parts were neatly packed. Instructions were simple and clear enough. I'm 5'3" and could assemble it by myself. The padding is a little stiff and front piece could use more--I use a pillow. The piece is sturdy and seems safe. Note that the handlebars aren't long enough to use for exercise--they are more to help with getting on and off.
customer_reviews.author: kmk

customer_reviews.title: Solid Good Roman chair
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy Roman chair, except for one thing, the padding on which you bend over can use some redesign as it is uncomfortable and a little unstable.
customer_reviews.author: Software Bugs Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Bad back Gr8 tool
customer_reviews.text: I recieved this product in very good shape. Brand new. No defects. I read many of the reviews b4 I bought it. Much to my surprise, the handlebars that men complained about, work perfectly for me. I am 6 ft to 6'1" 195lbs. Also the complaint I kept reading about too wide of a seat-pad is false for me. I wear a size 34 waist and This is one of the best Roman Benches I've ever worked out on. It took me about 40 mins to assemble with my bad back, nevertheless the insructions were simplistic and ez to follow. I am looking forward to many yrs to keep my back in shape and loose the next 10 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Indianalan Hoover

customer_reviews.title: It’s perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little bit to assemble but not bad. It’s pretty much basic. I’m still getting used to it. But I like what it provides.
customer_reviews.author: Blackstar5

customer_reviews.title: Not for over 6 feet
customer_reviews.text: I am 6 ft tall and 235 lb, it creaks when I do my inverse crunches on it. Also it kills my thighs, I guess it's for somebody shorter
customer_reviews.author: D Hawthorne

customer_reviews.title: Good piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Finally bought another piece of equipment that is big enough for the house and for fitness function. I am just waiting for the Warranty info and I will be set.
customer_reviews.author: Hardy Shelton3

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Normally don't do positive reviews, but this product very well packaged, easy instructions, and heavy duty. Thank you for doing the right thing and making a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not a good equipment choice for males...
customer_reviews.text: Look for a roman chair with the space in the middle. The large flat piece you bend over in this model is very uncomfortable for a male, and you'll end up with improper body mechanics trying to protect your genitalia.
customer_reviews.author: Tony A. Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply constructed
customer_reviews.text: Poorly designed the angle is awkward do not recommend. The padded rest is practicable board and will break off. No one in our household will use it.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Reverse Sit ups
customer_reviews.text: IT will get the job done. PROS: Steady, Does what its suppose to do. CONS: Flat pad has no place for the family jewels and the pad is thin.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Montalbine

customer_reviews.title: Good quality bench for back and abs.
customer_reviews.text: Great exercise bench. Can be used not only to do the back but very useful for abs as well. Construction is good, have had it for a year now and it is still in one piece (i use it 2-4 times a week). I wished the bench had a option to incline it in order to use it as a support for biceps exercises.
customer_reviews.author: vespa boy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This bench was completely useless because the post that you rest your stomach on was in a bad position. I ended up getting another bench and throwing this one out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is high quality and sturdy. Best of all
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely impressed with this product. Arrived quickly and packaged well. I put it together in less than 30 minutes and that includes 10 minutes looking for my adjustable wrench. It is high quality and sturdy. Best of all, all parts were in box and the directions were simple to follow! Thank You!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Debba

customer_reviews.title: Second one to buy... would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is easy. Bench is resistant. People under 5' tend to get scared to get on the machine because of the height of the machine, but this should not be a problem if the person knows how tobuse the bench and has control over his/her body. It is a great machine and totalky steady and safe to use. Should include a short exercise guide. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MJDIAZ

customer_reviews.title: A necessity
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. For someone who has back/sciatica issues, this thing is priceless. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Woods

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of machine
customer_reviews.text: I gave this one less because when it was listed it didn't come from Apex. It came from Bargain Ben so I paid $126. A few days later I saw it listed by Apex for $89. Could not get a refund and was not happy since I am a huge proponent of Amazon and its service. That said, this is cake to assemble. You will not only strengthen your back; you will feel it in your abs, your butt and the back of your legs. I do crunches and the first time I tried this I had to take 5 days off because my abs were SO sore. Takes up little space. Worth it
customer_reviews.author: ttrus11

customer_reviews.title: It's different
customer_reviews.text: This roman chair is very cool....but it is not quite like the hyper extension/roman chairs you will find in the big gyms....there's nowhere for you to rest your feet so doing side bends on this thing is nearly impossible....but it is great for doing "rocky" sit ups and reverse situps and that's all I really use it for anyway....I must mention that i am five seven and 140 lbs and I leaned forward to do reverse sit ups last night and this thing WOBBLED enough to scare me for a minute haha but it might have been due to me being off balance maybe...
customer_reviews.author: DevonRose

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: **You will most likely need additional tools to put this production together. ** The product is pretty sturdy and seems to be well-made. The assembly process was easy except that the provided tools could not complete the process. Some of the hex bolts were still lose and I needed to use a separate wrench to get them tight enough. The arms were mislabeled as well.
customer_reviews.author: Adam K

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy equipment but missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy equipment but the pad can be uncomfortable for your groin. Upon arrival the rear post was missing in the package and impex needed to be contacted. The piece was shipped quickly and arrived on the 3rd business day. Overall, I think this is a good value for the price. But impex/Marcy needs to do a better job at making sure their products are shipped with all the components as I've seen many other reviews where other components were missing.
customer_reviews.author: Chel

customer_reviews.title: Helps With My Back Injury
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I use it to help my bad back. When using it to perform reverse lifts, it really helps my back from an automobile accident. I also will hang for a few minutes to let my spine relax. This makes a major difference in the way my back feels.
customer_reviews.author: P. Allen

customer_reviews.title: My lower back is happy
customer_reviews.text: I had one earlier in life but got rid of it in a move. I recently really needed to strengthen my back again and got this. It's a tiny bit lightweight so you really have to ratch the nuts down when you're putting it together. It does the job for me and the price is right. the assembly instructions are almost completely useless. A good photo off it would be more helpful, but that wasn't in the box either.
customer_reviews.author: R. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Men, watch your groin!
customer_reviews.text: I kinda figured that the cushion might be challenging for men. There's definitely a reason why there's a woman pictured using the bench. This is not very cushiony at all. I don't have kids yet, but not sure if I ever will If I continue to smash my junk on this thing. It works. It does what you bought it for. It just needs some sort of Canal or Channel for the area that women do not have. Good price and good piece for the home gym collection. Just be careful that you don't get yourself in a "jamb".
customer_reviews.author: Code Red

customer_reviews.title: Can't use...hurts
customer_reviews.text: Too difficult to get on or use. Can't sell it. Have to put it out on trash day.
customer_reviews.author: s.lucas, Lucas Chihuahuas

customer_reviews.title: Fairly good hyperextension bench for price
customer_reviews.text: This basic hyperextension bench is decent. Does what its suppose to. Quality is sturdy. The instructions were simple enough to follow. A few things i don't like about it is that the two handle bars are really short. My chest is about 30 inches, and when i do dips, my chest barely touches the seat. So if the handles were even half a foot longer, that would of been great. Also, i feel that there could of been a little more padding on the seat, but its nothing too bad. Overall, its acceptable for me. I'm only 110 pounds though. So i basically only do sit ups and back lifts on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: TechNLoaded

customer_reviews.title: amazed on the quality
customer_reviews.text: Great item, great quality... this roman chair is a bargain for the price...
customer_reviews.author: oscar gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Saved my back!
customer_reviews.text: Have used these for years, but had to let my gym membership expire when I got a new job closer to home...this saved my back by giving me a place to do this excercise with out having to drive way outta my way to a gym. Assembly was very easy, and it handles my 300 lb, 6'-2" frame easily. About the only thing I did not like...that I have seen in numerous reviews was that the card that all the small parts (nuts and bolts) was shrink wrapped too, had come apart and there were quite a few parts loose in the box...other than that...I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Patriot1964

customer_reviews.title: Apex Roman chaif
customer_reviews.text: Since I have a limited space & budget, I was trying to find something to work my lower back area. This piece of equipment is just right. It was pretty easy to assemble [just a little help tightening the screws from my boyfriend] & fairly light weight, yet sturdy....for me. I'm very petite, so just about anything holds me. If you weigh 250lbs. & are also lifting weights, I could see how you'd need to stabilize it with some bolts or something, although the structure easily holds my boyfriend who's twice as big as me. With these qualifiers, I'd recommend it as a good item for home use.
customer_reviews.author: musicmill

customer_reviews.title: Good price and well made, holds me up at 230lbs
customer_reviews.text: I use this for back extensions, and its nice. I was looking for something different, but i thought i would give this a try because the price was right. I use it for back extensons and roman chair situps. Im 230 LBS and 6' and this unit is stable.
customer_reviews.author: michaelayoub

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, but...
customer_reviews.text: One of the arms COMPLETELY broke off (the right one). Please send a replacement. ***Update: I shipped back the broken handle and received a replacement immediately. Super happy.
customer_reviews.author: *Papa-Warrius*

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Good for a home gym, the board that you lay your stomach on could have been built a bit stronger. I leaned my hand on the bottom corner to pick myself onto the pad and i heard a crack sound. I now use the 2 arm handles to get into position.
customer_reviews.author: William Judge

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly & maximum fitness functionality
customer_reviews.text: Unusually quick and easy to assemble compared to most fitness equipment I’ve ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Black

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine
customer_reviews.text: Freaking works great! Love having this at home. It didn’t look sturdy but it really is .
customer_reviews.author: miranda

customer_reviews.title: Great for females expecially.
customer_reviews.text: Great for my wife. She loves it. However, I can't use it because the pad's not thick enough and it's to hard on the "package" if you can relate.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, not as effective
customer_reviews.text: THe quality was really nice. I just felt like the position it has you in, doesn’t work your back as well as the 45 degree angle. Also, even though it’s heavy, it feels like you can topple over easily... I had to put 25 lb weights on the base to help it be more stable.
customer_reviews.author: Proud2BGinger

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers pointed out, the pad is uncomfortably hard, especially for male users. Using a pillow helps, but it shouldn't have to come to that. Although the footprint of this hardware isn't huge, but it is not considered small either, and the fact that it isn't foldable means wherever you put it is wherever it will stay; you can't stow it in a closet or under the bed, and you can't easily move it around either. Assembling time took about 30 to 45 min, but most of that is turning the heavy duty nuts and bolts.
customer_reviews.author: R. Chiu

customer_reviews.title: Great piece added to my home gym!
customer_reviews.text: Just got mine yesterday. My UPS guy was super nice & I got to work on it right away. The instructions aren't the best but that's never a problem for me. It's not a small piece of equipment if that's what your expecting but it works great & looks great. I love mine. The bars/handles are perfect for me but I'm 5'5. Everything was nicely packaged. I used it & tried every exercise I use to do at the gym with a slightly different machine & I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Lady M

customer_reviews.title: Apex roman extention bench
customer_reviews.text: easy to assemble affordable compared to others I have found padded seat good quality made to last. I think I made a good investment I can now really work out my back muscles and stomach intensely. This bench will get those love hands burned off quickly mine are gone my six pack is now coming back after using it for two weeks . 4 times a week . I do 50 back extensions and sit ups with this thing I can see a difference big time.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to my home gym.
customer_reviews.text: It may have just been those who were assembling it who did not completely comprehend the assembly instructions, but it seems slightly unstable as I exercise with it. Otherwise it's a great purchase and I wish I had purchased it much sooner. I think The bolts just need to be tightened.
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy professional equipment
customer_reviews.text: A nice sturdy piece of equipment i am 210lbs and this ones i very stable even eith my weight
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good piece of equipment for the money!
customer_reviews.text: For the money, it is a very good piece of equipment. It will accomplish back extension as intended. Feels very sturdy, which was a concern. I'm 5'9", 175lbs, if that helps. I have back issues and the stretch also feels good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect. It feels very stable
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect. It feels very stable. I'm 5'10" and 180 pounds and it is solid. I can see how a girl who is 5'0" would have trouble getting on without a small stool, but I can't see how that could be solved. I don't think most people will have trouble getting on this, though
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic piece of gym equipment
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic piece of gym equipment. I picked it up for about 50 bucks and use it almost every day. This thing is sturdy enough if you're less than 200 pounds. If you weigh more than that, you might want to try a different machine.
customer_reviews.author: AA

product_meta.title: Marcy Adjustable Hyperextension Roman Chair / Exercise Hyper Bench JD-3.1
product_meta.description:
Have an optimal body workout and build some rock-hard abs with the Marcy Roman Chair!

Made of premium-quality tubing frame with a powder-coated finish, this gym apparatus is guaranteed to stand the test of time. Its stability and ergonomic style allows you to perform intense workouts without having to leave the comfort of your home.

Carve out those rock-hard abs you’ve always wanted with this training bench that can help you perform challenging exercises to develop your core. It can also strengthen your lower back and give superb definition to your glutes and hamstring muscles at the same time.

The back hyperextension bench lets you position correctly while performing a variety of movements. Sit and lean backward to develop your core or flip over to perform back workouts with targeted motions.

The Marcy Roman Chair features high-density foam, padded handles, adjustable two-foam leg holders, and polymer upholstery to accommodate a variety of workout regimens with convenience and comfort. Its sleek and compact design allows you to store it conveniently in a corner in conjunction with the rest of your exercise equipment. Simply tuck it into a small space when it’s not in use. Get into shape right in the comfort of your own home!



AMAZON.COM
Apex Roman/Hyper Extension Bench allows you to get off the floor to stretch and strengthen your core abdominal and back muscles for improved fitness. This sturdy chair is well constructed and easy to set up with simple instructions. Designed to last for years of use, the Apex bench provides a more comfortable way to work your core muscle groups. With padded handles and adjustable two-foam leg holders, it is possible to perform challenging exercises without a trainer or spotter. Your legs are held in place by the supports, and you are able to hyperextend your abdominals, accessing more muscle groups. 

Boasting a super-sturdy heavy-gauge steel-tubing frame, the sleek bench will tuck into the corner of a room when not in use, and high-density deluxe boxed upholstery will hold up over time. Whether you would like to build and maintain six-pack abs or strengthen your core to ease back pain and improve your posture, the Apex Roman/Hyper Extension Bench is a safe and solid way to target your goals.








IMPORTANT SAFETY NOTICE

PRECAUTIONS

This exercise machine is built for optimum safety. However, certain precautions apply whenever you operate a piece of exercise equipment. Be sure to read the entire manual before you assemble or operate your machine. In particular, note the following safety precautions:

1. Keep children and pets away from the machine at all times. DO NOT 

leave children unattended in the same room with the machine.

2. Only one person at a time should use the machine.

3. If the user experiences dizziness, nausea, chest pain, or any other abnormal

symptoms, STOP the workout at once. CONSULT A PHYSICIAN

IMMEDIATELY.

4. Position the machine on a clear, leveled surface. DO NOT use the machine

near water or outdoors.

5. Keep hands away from all moving parts.

6. Always wear appropriate workout clothing when exercising. DO NOT wear 

robes or other clothing that could become caught in the machine. Running 

or aerobic shoes are also required when using the machine.

7. Use the machine only for its intended use as described in this manual. DO 

NOT use attachments not recommended by the manufacturer.

8. Do not place any sharp object around the machine.

9. Disabled person should not use the machine without a qualified person or 

physician in attendance.

10. Before using the machine to exercise, always do stretching exercises to 

properly warm up.

11. Never operate the machine if the machine is not functioning properly.

WARNING: BEFORE BEGINNING ANY EXERCISE PROGRAM, CONSULT YOUR PHYSICIAN. THIS IS ESPECIALLY IMPORTANT FOR INDIVIDUALS OVER THE AGE OF 35 OR PERSONS WITH PRE-EXISTING HEALTH PROBLEMS. READ ALL INSTRUCTIONS BEFORE USING ANY FITNESS EQUIPMENT. IMPEX INC. ASSUMES NO RESPONSIBILITY FOR PERSONAL INJURY OR PROPERTY DAMAGE SUSTAINED BY OR THROUGH THE USE OF THIS PRODUCT.
feature_bullets: VERSATILE EQUIPMENT – This training bench can be used for a wide variety of abdominal workouts. It helps strengthen the lower back while targeting the glutes and hamstring muscles for superb definition. Carve out the rock-hard abs you’ve always wanted with this equipment that allows you to perform challenging workouts to develop your core.

HYPEREXTENSION BENCH – The Marcy Roman Chair features a back hyperextension station that lets you position yourself correctly while performing a variety of movements. Sit and lean backward to develop your core or flip over to perform back workouts with targeted motions.

INTEGRATED PADDING – This gym equipment comes with high-density foam, padded handles, adjustable two-foam leg holders, and polymer upholstery to accommodate a variety of workout regimens for your convenience and maximum comfort.

PREMIUM QUALITY CONSTRUCTION – Made with a sturdy, heavy-duty tubing frame with a powder-coated finish, this equipment is guaranteed to stand the test of time! It won’t sway under your weight, as the structure’s solid frame and ergonomic style guarantee reliable stability for every workout regimen.

GYM-AT-HOME EXPERIENCE – Whether you’d like to strengthen your core, ease back pain, improve your posture, or build your six-pack abs, the Marcy Roman Chair will bring you a safe and solid way to work on your fitness goals right in the comfort of home! Its sleek and compact design allows you to store it conveniently in a corner in conjunction with the rest of your exercise equipment. Simply tuck it into a small space when it’s not in use.
